cs34q.turtle

Class TurtleDisplay

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • cs34q.turtle.TurtleDisplay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TurtleListener, java.awt.event.ComponentListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class TurtleDisplay
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.ComponentListener, TurtleListener
    Class for displaying lines drawn by a Logo Turtle. A TurtleDisplay uses an internal coordinate system in which the origin is in the centre of the screen, and the lower left corner is at coordinate (-200, -2100) and the upper right corner is at (200, 200). The TurtleDisplay will automatically rescale these coordinates to pixels, as the screen is resized, so the visible region always has coordinates whose absolute values are less than 100. However, after a resize operation, the current image will be cleared. Although intended to display a Logo Turtle, the TurtleDisplay does not directly support Logo operations, nor does it have a representation of the turtle object. Instead, there are functions to draw line segments, and to display (or hide) the turtle on the display. These functions require complete information (e.g. coordinates of both end points of a line segment, or the coordinates and bearing of the turtle).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
